context: Construction is currently underway on the Miami Intermodal Center and Miami Central Station, a massive transportation hub servicing Metrorail, Amtrak, Tri-Rail, Metrobus, Greyhound Lines, taxis, rental cars, MIA Mover, private automobiles, bicycles and pedestrians adjacent to <a3_0><b8_0>Miami International<a3_0/> Airport<b8_0/>. Completion of the Miami Intermodal Center is expected to be completed by winter <a0_0><b5_0>2011<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and will serve over <a2_0><b7_0>150,000<b7_0/><a2_0/> commuters and travelers in the Miami area. Phase I of Miami Central Station is scheduled to begin service in the <a4_0><b9_0>spring<b9_0/><a4_0/> of 2012, and Phase II in <a1_0><b6_0>2013<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
